events.name: A React Point of Vue
events.description:
## Talk description

At a glance, React and Vue are like two peas in a pod. They are lightweight component-based libraries for building user interfaces and can be used fairly interchangeably to build scalable web applications. Though they are noticeably different in terms of syntax, their key differences lie in their respective ways of thinking. As a React developer learning Vue, adapting to the “Vue way of doing things” is a challenge that requires a sound understanding of the philosophy behind Vue. In this talk, we will examine the nuances between the two frameworks and cover common mistakes that React developers make when switching from React to Vue.

## About the speaker

Divya is a web developer who is passionate about open source and good documentation. She most recently made the switch from React to Vue and has slowly but surely grown to enjoy the Vue. You will most likely find her in the sunniest spot in the room with a cup of tea in hand and puns on hand.

events.name: React Chicago + ReactJS Wisconsin Unite
events.description:
On June 12th React Chicago and React JS Wisconsin will be uniting efforts to share and engage the React community in the Midwest. Every month there are multiple React events, and we want to connect our members to different perspectives from different companies and experts in the React community.

We are incredibly excited about joining our events!! We will share what is happening in Chicago and learn more about the Milwaukee scene without having to find parking!

Each group will present via a webcast to the other group along with the ability to ask questions to the speakers. Milwaukee and Chicago will host their events as regularly scheduled with networking, swag, food, and beverages. Although this time there is the bonus of hearing from new speakers, different companies, unique perspectives and making new connections in a different city.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Agenda:

5:30 Registration, beer, wine & local food

6:00 React JS Milwaukee Presents: Providing Context Around the Context API

Presented by: AJ Zozakiewcz & Ruben Manrique

Description: Introduced with React 16.3, the Context API gives us another way to manage data. Context allows us to pass data through the component tree without having to pass props down manually at every level.

In this talk, we will try to provide some “context” around what it is and how to use it. We will go over some real-world use cases, dos and don’ts, and examples of how we are starting to take advantage of this feature at Northwestern Mutual.

6:30 React Chicago Presents: Offline access with React Native + Redux

Speaker: Tyson Kunovsky

Description: This talk is focused on creating solid user experiences for offline access in React Native apps. In order to do this, we will take a look at libraries like redux-persist and react-native-offline, and will even hook up redux-form to persist form values.

7:00 Networking - We will try to virtually mingle as well as our regularly scheduled networking

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Meet our speakers!

Tyson Kunovsky

Bio: Originally from South Africa, Tyson is a passionate full-stack engineer who manages the tech team over at Inspire11 consulting. After attending the University of Washington he worked for several startups before transitioning into enterprise consulting. Most recently he built and sold a software consulting agency (Lambda Consulting) where he focused on the healthcare, construction, and finance sectors, building out large-scale distributed systems for Fortune 500 companies. Tyson enjoys both engineering/architecture and leading agile development teams to create beautiful products. He is energized by people and loves to approach development with collaborative and communicative attitude.

Ruben Manrique

Ruben Manrique is a Fullstack Engineer for Northwestern Mutual who has been in the industry for over 7 years. He has a wide array of experience from back-end technologies such as Java, Python, C#, and NodeJS, to front-end technologies such as Angular, Backbone, and React. At his current position, he is focused on creating a better user experience for the client using tools such as React and NodeJS.

AJ Zozakiewicz:

AJ Zozakiewiczis an Engineering Lead for Northwestern Mutual and has been developing in web and JavaScript technologies for many years. His current focus includes building applications using React, React Native, Node.js, Express.js, and many other bleeding edge frameworks.

This event is made possible by our sponsor Northwestern Mutual, who is dedicated to making Milwaukee a great place to live and work in tech.

events.name: ReasonML - A Love Story by Peter Piekarczyk
events.description:
When I first met ReactJS, it was love at first sight. We built beautiful UIs for years together with our firstborn, Redux. I felt like nothing would get between us. Not even when a younger, skinnier version came along (Preact). Life was good.

Everything changed when ReasonReact showed up on our block. I was curious, of course. Didn’t act on it, though. Why would I? We’d run into each other a lot since we shared the same circles. One day, the temptations got too strong. What was I thinking? Nothing about what I was doing felt right, at first. I was leaving a lot behind but for some weird reason, I knew I’d end up here anyway. I mean, it’s not like we’re splitting apart. React will still be there, but so will Reason...

I’m here to announce my love affair.

Bio:

Peter’s an engineer who seeks to bring value into your life by building something you’ll actually use. He started his first dev shop when he was 12 and has been building stuff ever since. A big fan of Javascript & React, Peter is apart of the official ReactJS Community on Github and regular contributes to the React Native ecosystem. He’s actively seeking a La Croix sponsorship.

events.name: GraphQL for absolute beginners
events.description:
GraphQL is new and exciting API-definition from Facebook. It makes your life easier to fetch data from multiple resources. GraphQL makes API consumer in charge.

It is a powerful abstraction that reduces memory consumption, orchestration. Facebook is using GraphQL to improve API performance and the world is implementing GraphQL to make their API maintainable. Join this talk to learn how GraphQL will revolutionize API development as you know it.

We will introduce GraphQL - what it is; when it might be appropriate (and when it might not). There will be a demo and introduction to popular tools.

events.name: Redefine your React Thinking and Twice Around the JS Loop
events.description:
Talk-1:: Redefine your React Thinking by Jhankar Mahbub (30min)
Description: React is the most popular JavaScript framework out there. To become a proficient front-end developer, you need to know the latest addition to the React world.

We will talk about the Context API, Fragments, Portals, fiber, and all the new cool and shiny things added. These concepts will help you to think differently and will make you a smarter React Developer.

. . .

Talk-2:: Twice Around the JS Loop by Josh Beckman (45min)

Description: Your code probably has promises, setTimeouts, setImmediates, requestAnimationFrames, style updates, process.nextTicks, etc. Do you have some bugs that pop up when those sequences happen out of order? Wouldn’t it be great to understand what governs the order of all those events?

This talk explains and demystifies JavaScript's event loop, the thing that orchestrates the main thread of your browser, which includes JavaScript, events, and rendering. We'll look at the difference between tasks, micro tasks, paints, and where events land. We will also touch on the event loop in NodeJS, its subtle differences, and the considerations I/O brings to the loop on your server.
By the end, you’ll be scheduling your async JavaScript code like a Pro!

events.name: Becoming a Software Developer - Q&A Panel with Current Developers in Chicago
events.description:
• What we'll do
Interested in becoming a software developer?

Curious to learn more about how to get into the field, and if a coding bootcamp could help?

Join us for a panel of software developers who graduated Fullstack Academy and learn everything you need to know!

Join Fullstack Academy for some pizza at our next public alum panel. Get advice on how to become a developer, what the job is like on a day-to-day basis, and what steps you can take now to start your path there. Our alums will share their stories of how they became interested in becoming software developers, how they got into Fullstack Chicago, and what their work days are like at their current companies. After the panel, you're welcome to stick around to network and speak with staff about Fullstack's admission process, curriculum, and career support.

The event starts with free pizza and a short networking session!

We look forward to seeing you there.

Agenda:

6:30pm-7:00pm: Checkin, Pizza, Fullstack Overview
7:00pm-7:30pm: Alum Panel
7:30pm-8:00pm: Open Q/A

events.name: Getting Started with React and React Fundamentals
events.description:
React is the most popular JavaScript framework. It has a very unique approach to avoid expensive DOM updates by using virtual DOM approach to provide flexibility and performance gain. It's component oriented architecture make front-end development very modern, scalable and efficient.

In this talk, we will cover everything you need to get started building production-ready applications with React. This talk will cover

* React Core Concepts

* JSX

* Props

* States

* Component

* Component Life Cycle

* Virtual DOM

* Routing

* Load server-side data

Dev Alert: There will be live coding during this talk.

. . . . .

One to learn more?
Join the Day long React workshop on July 14.
This is once in a year opportunity to learn React form expert and build a professional app. A full day hands-on React workshop. (Coffee, Lunch and snacks will be provided)
Click here to Register (
class=
>https://www.eventbrite.com/e/exclusive-react-training-for-beginners-tickets-44352913759)
events.how_to_find_us: There will be meetup sign inside the  building. There will be Enova person to give access to the elevator. If you can't locate send a message to the meetup organizer

events.name: Web Development Mentorship
events.description:
Teaching yourself how to code? Want to meet other coders in the Chicago area? Chicago Web Development Mentorship is for you!

Chicago Web Development Mentorship is simply a free space to work, a space to collaborate, and a space to network and learn from each other. All levels of experience are welcome, and for those of you new to coding, we'll be able to point you to some great online resources for beginners.

Bring your laptop & charger (no computers provided), and a friend, if you want!

NOTE: Please RSVP on Eventbrite (
class=
>https://www.eventbrite.com/e/chicago-web-development-mentorship-tickets-45971288361) to confirm your attendance.

events.name: Free Admissions Prep Workshop
events.description:
Studying for the application process at Fullstack Academy? Join the workshop that takes you through the coding assessment step-by-step. We'll review the challenges and run through practice problems, answering questions along the way.

At the end of the session, you'll feel more confident in your skills and be ready to take the next step towards becoming a developer.

Get a better sense for the application requirements on the Admissions Prep Materials page (
class=

>https://www.fullstackacademy.com/admissions-preparation).

Workshop Agenda

1. Welcome from Instructors

2. Test-taking strategies: tips on how to ace the admissions coding assessment

3. Coding Challenges: attendees will pair up to solve the 5+ problems in 20-minute blocks

4. Each problem will be followed by a 10-minute review to address the solution

5. Attendees will leave the workshop having completed several coding challenges and receive Review Videos

Reminders:

-- Bring a laptop and charger!
-- We aren't providing a lunch break, so bring snacks to tide you over!
-- Please arrive on time to maximize the effectiveness of the workshop

If you are a beginner, we recommend you complete as many of the following units 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 of Codecademy's JavaScript track (
class=
>https://www.codecademy.com/learn/introduction-to-javascript) as possible before the workshop.

events.name: Joint Meetup: Node.js + Serverless covering THREE talks
events.description:
This will be a joint Meetup between the Chicago Node.js Meetup and the Chicago Serverless Meetup.

First Talk - Serverless Tour of Heroes with Jon Gear
A practical walkthrough of the Angular Tour of Heroes demo application digitally remaster with serverless architecture. We will discuss hosting our SPA with CloudFront backed by API Gateway with data models sourced out of DynamoDB. We will also discuss setting up a CI pipeline for our application to allow for seamless zero downtime deployments

Second Talk - Lambda functions simplified with Arc.codes by Mike Hostetler
Interested in getting into Serverless? We'll walk through setting up a project with Arc.codes, the easiest way to build simple and useful applications with Lambda functions.

Third Talk - Square Peg Round Hole Serverless Solutions For Non Serverless Problems by Chase Douglas
Learn how to handle DB connection limits, rate limit applications, and build general state machines using basic serverless resources!

Schedule

6:00 - 6:15 :: Food and Networking

6:15 - 7:15 :: Main Presentation

7:00 - 7:15 :: Open Mic

Chicago Node.js Events

Food is always provided!

You must answer the RSVP question with your full, legal name. This allows you to get passed security for the building.

Would you be interested in speaking?

An important goal for this Meetup is to provide a forum for local Chicago developers to build their presentation skills. If you'd like to present, but don't know where to start, please contact the Organizers (
class=

>http://mike-hostetler.com/contact) for help. We're more then willing to help.

If you don't need help and just want to submit a talk, please fill out this form:
class=

>https://goo.gl/forms/dzNuH3NSLXxn6UZq2

Resources

Chicago Tech Code of Conduct - Our Meetup abides by the Chicago Tech Code of Conduct. If you plan to attend, please be mindful of this. You can read the Code of Conduct here:
class=

>http://j.mp/ChiTechCoC

Chicago Tech Slack - Please join us on the Chicago Tech Slack's #nodejs channel to keep the conversation going between Meetups. You can join here:
class=

>http://chicagotechslack.com

Node.js Weekly - Cooper Press publishes a great weekly newsletter on Node.js topics, you can sign up at
class=
>http://nodeweekly.com/
events.how_to_find_us: 10th Floor, North Elevators, you must check in with security

events.name: Monthly Meetup: Topic TBD
events.description:
# Monthly Meetup!

The topic is TBD. If you have a suggestion, let us know!

# Schedule

Thank you to ActiveCampaign for hosting!

5:30pm: Start arriving for networking, drinks, food
6:00pm: Presentations starts
events.how_to_find_us: Head into the lobby, towards the elevators; someone will direct you up to the 5th floor

events.name: JavaScript 101 Workshop (On-Campus)
events.description:
Take the first steps on your Road to Code, and get a feeling for what Fullstack Academy is all about. This 3-hour class is for the pure beginner who wants an introduction to writing JavaScript - perhaps for the very first time! There is no pre-work required.

Every journey has a first step. And that’s what you’ll be doing by taking this workshop. You’ll spend a few hours on our campus, getting a feeling for the Fullstack “vibe” and starting to learn the basics of JavaScript.

Workshop Agenda:

1. Welcome from the instructors

2. Automate your life with code: Learn what “code” really is, how it works, and how you can apply it to your everyday life.

3. Learn Google Apps Script: You’ll hit the ground running by using Google’s awesome JavaScript platform. Build a cool project: You’ll pull together what you’ve just learned to build your first app. You'll write many scripts, for example, one that will scan your email contacts' information and send them a message when it's their birthday.

4. Next steps on your Road to Code

More info

For more details about this workshop, please visit:
class=

>http://www.fullstackacademy.com/javascript-101

Reminders

-- Bring a laptop & charger!
-- We aren't providing a meal break, so bring snacks to tide you over!
-- Please arrive on time to maximize the effectiveness of the workshop
events.how_to_find_us: Once you get to 405, there will be someone in the lobby to let you in, or a sign on the door will offer further instructions.

Teaching yourself how to code? Want to meet other coders in the Chicago area? Chicago Web Development Mentorship is for you!

Chicago Web Development Mentorship is simply a free space to work, a space to collaborate, and a space to network and learn from each other. All levels of experience are welcome, and for those of you new to coding, we'll be able to point you to some great online resources for beginners.

class=

events.name: Is a Coding Bootcamp for You? Fullstack Academy Information Session
events.description:
Calling all tech and web enthusiasts in Chicago! Are you interested in learning how to code, especially in JavaScript, and are looking to take your skills and knowledge to the next level? Have you tried learning to code on you own, but feel that a coding bootcamp could provide you with more content and structure?

Fullstack Academy has you covered. Drop by our campus for a free information session about the awesome coding courses we provide, our community, and advice on how to get started on the road to becoming a software engineer.

Some topics of discussion will be:
-- Why we teach JavaScript
-- How to get started on the Road to Code
-- What you will get out of the Fullstack Experience

An informal Q&A session will follow the talk.

Please RSVP on Eventbrite (
class=

>https://www.eventbrite.com/e/fullstack-academy-information-session-chicago-campus-tickets-30340891423?aff=meetupinfosession) as well to confirm your attendance.

We look forward to meeting you!
- The Fullstack Team, Chicago
